mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Anna Maria Washington Thornton to George Fayette Washington, 1815 February 12
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Thornton, Anna Maria Washington, 1788-1816
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Anna writes from Greenwood to her brother George Fayette of her ill health over a long period -- pain in breast and cough -- describes the medicines she has been taking and efforts to get a doctor from Fredericksburg or elsewhere -- hopes to visit him in summer by packet "if the British will be good enough to keep out of the way." -- writes of her children, Charles and Churchill -- scolds him for not writing. Autograph letter signed, 4 pages, (under cover of letter of March 1) watermark. Name on original manuscript appears as "A. M. Thornton."
